response.answer_text: Personally, I think it's like asking “Are people dangerous?” Ghosts are formed when people die. Sometimes they realize they're dead, sometimes they dont. But they definitely carry their personality to the other world. Some things they learn or pick up later. But they are also governed by a few rules, just like we are -eat, drink, sleep and cycles of time. Most ghosts can't leave from one place; they're stuck. Now with lockdown and all, how do you feel? Stuck? Irritated? Angry and cranky? Now imagine this lockdown goes on for years together. How would you feel then? Now imagine someone comes inside your house and asks you, “Respond if you can hear me” Or “show me your presence”. INSIDE your house. Or better still, asks a favour of you or tries to enrage you just to get a response from you. How would you feel? What would you do? Place yourself in that situation, really put yourself in that situation and you'll find out how the ghosts feel. Now, are ghosts dangerous? Tell me, are people dangerous? Of course, they are. People are capable of any amount of atrocities on another human being or on more than one people. Ghosts have the benefit of being invisible. INVISIBLE. That's what you are up against when you go poking around in their world. Now tell me, how do you read people? How do you find out whether they are good or bad, dangerous or nice, or whether they can harm you or help you? By looking at their eyes, their expression, their body language, and hearing them speak. Right? Ghosts do nothing of this. So how will you find out? That's why they are dangerous, that's why they should never be poked, that's why they should never be invoked or angered, because you never know what their intentions are for you. You wouldn't even know if they are near you or have left you alone. So it's best to keep away from them.

Yes in my opinion paranormal is dangerous. In India Gaurav Tiwari died Curiously.  Gaurav Tiwari was the CEO and Founder of Indian Paranormal Society. He was seen on different television channels in India, promoting Paranormal Research. Gaurav has featured in MTV Girl's Night Out with Rannvijay, Haunted Weekends with Sunny Leone and various other shows on different News Channels such as Aaj Tak, Live India, News 24, Star TV, Zee TV etc. Gaurav was also seen on Zee Fear Files as a paranormal expert.  He was a Certified Leading Paranormal Investigator, Certified UFO Field Investigator and a ParaNexusrepresentative in India. He has also been famous on international Paranormal Radio Shows.Gaurav has earned international reputation for himself and his team after busting the haunting myths of Bhangarh, and also for his work in establishing India's first scientific paranormal research association. Gaurav had also featured as an investigator for SyFy's series called 'Haunting: Australia' with Robb Demarest who was ex-Lead investigator for Ghost Hunters International. Gaurav was also seen as an expert in Sony TV's new series Bhoot Aaya which was based on his research and investigations. Gaurav Tiwari was found dead at his Dwarka home on 7 July 2016. According to Delhi Police, it was a case of asphyxiation, but several arguments against this theory were raised on social media and news networks. His body was found lying on his bathroom floor with a thin black line across his neck. According to his family, they heard a loud thud from his bathroom at around 11AM on Thursday. They forced their way through the locked door to find Tiwari lying unresponsive on the floor. He was rushed to a hospital but could not be resuscitated.
